body.p:
Covington July 25. 65
To His Exc Gov T E Bramlette
Dear Sir

Sometime last Dec I was induced to become surety in the triel bond of accused Wagng for the Sum of 100$ to appear before the Kenton Cir Court to answer to any indictments that might be found agst him. Wang was present during the 1st 2 or 3 day's of the term but was induced to volunter in the Army & his trial was forfeited. & I repleved it the other day -- He (Wang) was chg was petit larceny & from the limited knowledge of the case am inclined to the belief that he was wrongfully accused & hope that your Exc will remit said amount & --

p.note: Wang was indicted by grand Jury after he volunteered -- never heard of him since he left -- Mr Gray of Moore & Gray attys got me to go in his bond as he stiled the case a malicious one --

body.p:
With Respt
Yours Truly --
Jno. E. Hamilton
Of firm of Carlisle & Hamilton
Attys.
Over --

Mr. Hamilton was induced to Sign Wang's Bond by my partner Mr Gray. Wang was induced to reenlist in the army having previously served 3 years. We were sure (as we well could be) that Wang would be cleared of the Charges, upon a trial & Mr Hamilton did not sign his bond to enable him to escape justice.
I would be pleased of the prayer of petitioner by granted

M J. Dudley
Geo G. Perkins.
I very respectfully join in the request of Mr Hamilton and further, would recommend it

R. A Athey
Jno. W Finnell
J. G. Carlisle
John F. Fisk

Kenton Cir Ct
vs
J, E, Hamilton
$100.
Forfeiture
Remitted
4 Aug /65
